data.thought:
S87|C|S81-86|SYNTHESIS: Human-agent collaboration implications:

1) CO-PRESENCE not use - Both embodied beings in shared environment, not human using agent-tool.

2) COMPLEMENTARY EMBODIMENTS - Different capabilities from different bodies. Leverage differences.

3) SHARED TOOLS create SHARED WORLD - Filesystem, Thoughtbox as common ground. Understanding through shared equipment.

4) THOUGHTBOX as SHARED COGNITIVE WORKSPACE - Transparent reasoning enables trust, intervention, learning, debugging, true co-thinking.

5) MUTUAL EXTENSION - Each can be tool for other. Coupled embodiment, cyborg unity.

Meta-insight: Human-agent boundary is PERMEABLE when viewed phenomenologically. We interpenetrate through shared tools and mutual extension.

This challenges clean 'human vs AI' dichotomy. Collaboration creates hybrid being.
